trans-unit.source: Archetypes
trans-unit.target: Archetypes

trans-unit.source: Intermediate Designer
trans-unit.target: Intermediate Designer

trans-unit.source: An archetype is a master asset that controls the properties of assets you derive from it. Derived assets are useful when you want to create a "remixed" version of an asset.
trans-unit.target: An archetype is a master asset that controls the properties of assets you derive from it. Derived assets are useful when you want to create a "remixed" version of an asset.

trans-unit.source: For example, imagine we have three sphere entities that share a material asset named Metal. The Metal asset has properties including color, gloss, and so on.
trans-unit.target: For example, imagine we have three sphere entities that share a material asset named Metal. The Metal asset has properties including color, gloss, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Three metal spheres
trans-unit.target: Three metal spheres

trans-unit.source: If we change a property in the Metal asset, it applies to all three spheres. So, for example, if we change the color property, all three spheres change color.
trans-unit.target: If we change a property in the Metal asset, it applies to all three spheres. So, for example, if we change the color property, all three spheres change color.

trans-unit.source: Three gold spheres
trans-unit.target: Three gold spheres

trans-unit.source: Now imagine we want to change the color of only one sphere, but keep its other properties the same. We could duplicate the material asset, change its color, and then apply the new asset to only one sphere. But if we later want to change a different property across all the spheres, we have to modify both assets. This is time-consuming and leaves room for mistakes.
trans-unit.target: Now imagine we want to change the color of only one sphere, but keep its other properties the same. We could duplicate the material asset, change its color, and then apply the new asset to only one sphere. But if we later want to change a different property across all the spheres, we have to modify both assets. This is time-consuming and leaves room for mistakes.

trans-unit.source: The better approach is to derive a new asset from the archetype. The derived asset inherits properties from the archetype and lets you override individual properties where you need them. For example, we can derive the sphere's material asset and override its color. Then, if we change the gloss of the archetype, the gloss of all three spheres changes.
trans-unit.target: The better approach is to derive a new asset from the archetype. The derived asset inherits properties from the archetype and lets you override individual properties where you need them. For example, we can derive the sphere's material asset and override its color. Then, if we change the gloss of the archetype, the gloss of all three spheres changes.

trans-unit.source: Create derived asset
trans-unit.target: Create derived asset

trans-unit.source: You can derive an asset from an archetype, then in turn derive another asset from that derived asset. This way you can create different layers of assets to keep your project organized:
trans-unit.target: You can derive an asset from an archetype, then in turn derive another asset from that derived asset. This way you can create different layers of assets to keep your project organized:

trans-unit.source: Archetype Derived asset Derived asset
trans-unit.target: Archetype Derived asset Derived asset

trans-unit.source: Derive an asset from an archetype
trans-unit.target: Derive an asset from an archetype

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, right-click the asset you want to derive an asset from and select Create derived asset:
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, right-click the asset you want to derive an asset from and select Create derived asset:

trans-unit.source: Create derived asset
trans-unit.target: Create derived asset

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds a new derived asset to the project. This asset derives its properties from the archetype asset.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds a new derived asset to the project. This asset derives its properties from the archetype asset.

trans-unit.source: The derived asset properties display the archetype asset under Archetype:
trans-unit.target: The derived asset properties display the archetype asset under Archetype:

trans-unit.source: Derived asset in Property Grid
trans-unit.target: Derived asset in Property Grid

trans-unit.source: You can right-click the archetype asset in the Property Grid and select Select the referenced asset to quickly select the archetype asset:
trans-unit.target: You can right-click the archetype asset in the Property Grid and select Select the referenced asset to quickly select the archetype asset:

trans-unit.source: Select referenced asset
trans-unit.target: Select referenced asset

trans-unit.source: Overridden properties
trans-unit.target: Overridden properties

trans-unit.source: The Property Grid shows which properties of the derived asset differ from the archetype. Overridden and unique properties are white, and inherited (identical) properties are gray.
trans-unit.target: The Property Grid shows which properties of the derived asset differ from the archetype. Overridden and unique properties are white, and inherited (identical) properties are gray.

trans-unit.source: In this screenshot, the Diffuse Map property is overridden. The other properties are inherited:
trans-unit.target: In this screenshot, the Diffuse Map property is overridden. The other properties are inherited:

trans-unit.source: Overridden properties are white
trans-unit.target: Overridden properties are white

trans-unit.source: Reset a property to archetype value
trans-unit.target: Reset a property to archetype value

trans-unit.source: You can reset overridden or unique properties of a derived asset to the values in the archetype. To do this, right-click the overridden property and select Reset to base value.
trans-unit.target: You can reset overridden or unique properties of a derived asset to the values in the archetype. To do this, right-click the overridden property and select Reset to base value.

trans-unit.source: Reset to base value
trans-unit.target: Reset to base value

trans-unit.source: Clear an archetype
trans-unit.target: Clear an archetype

trans-unit.source: You can remove the link between the archetype and the derived asset. This means the derived asset no longer inherits changes to the archetype; it becomes a completely independent.
trans-unit.target: You can remove the link between the archetype and the derived asset. This means the derived asset no longer inherits changes to the archetype; it becomes a completely independent.

trans-unit.source: To do this, in the Asset View, right-click the derived asset and select Clear archetype.
trans-unit.target: To do this, in the Asset View, right-click the derived asset and select Clear archetype.

trans-unit.source: Clear archetype
trans-unit.target: Clear archetype

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also
